info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 1 at 7:32PM EDT until July 1 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS State College PA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Lancaster.
* WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 729 PM EDT, Local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Willow Street, New Holland, Paradise, Strasburg, Quarryville, Gap, Wakefield, Churchtown, Smithville, Holtwood, Safe Harbor, Shenks Ferry, Lampeter, Intercourse, Conestoga, Christiana, Blue Ball, Georgetown, Gordonville and Goodville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
